alert.note: Alert for Kent; New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of New Castle, northwestern Kent and western Salem Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 115 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bear to near Middletown to near Hartly. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Dover, Newark, Middletown, Pennsville, Smyrna, Carneys Point, Elsmere, New Castle, Penns Grove, Salem, Alloway, Clayton, Quinton, Delaware City, Cheswold, Newport, Arden, Hartly and Stanton. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 1. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 0. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 3 and 23. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
